tidbits.title: Polynesian Culture
tidbits.description: The Cook Islands boast a rich Polynesian culture, evident in traditional dance, music, intricate crafts like tivaevae (quilting), and warm hospitality.

tidbits.title: Stunning Scenery
tidbits.description: The islands feature stunning scenery with turquoise lagoons, coral reefs, and lush green mountains, offering picturesque landscapes for visitors.

tidbits.title: Self-Governing Nation
tidbits.description: The Cook Islands are a self-governing nation in free association with New Zealand, maintaining its own government while benefiting from close ties.
